intro: Chionanthus maxwellii, commonly known as the Maxwell's fringeflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or cream-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has fragrant, tubular flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in a cascading pattern. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
